com.google.enterprise.connector.util.diffing

Interface DocumentSnapshotRepositoryMonitorManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DocumentSnapshotRepositoryMonitorManagerImpl, FakeDocumentSnapshotRepositoryMonitorManager

    public interface DocumentSnapshotRepositoryMonitorManager
    Management interface to DocumentSnapshotRepositoryMonitor threads.
    Since:
    2.8

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start(java.lang.String checkpoint)
           throws RepositoryException
        Ensures all monitor threads are running.
        Parameters:
        checkpoint - for the last completed document or null if none have been completed.
        Throws:
        RepositoryException

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops all the configured DocumentSnapshotRepositoryMonitor threads.

      • clean

        void clean()
        Removes persisted state for DocumentSnapshotRepositoryMonitor threads. After calling this DocumentSnapshotRepositoryMonitor threads will no longer be able to resume from where they left off last time.

      • getThreadCount

        int getThreadCount()
        Returns the number of DocumentSnapshotRepositoryMonitor threads that are alive. This method is for testing purposes.

      • getCheckpointAndChangeQueue

        CheckpointAndChangeQueue getCheckpointAndChangeQueue()
        Returns the CheckpointAndChangeQueue for this DocumentSnapshotRepositoryMonitorManager

      • isRunning

        boolean isRunning()
        Returns whether we are after a start() call and before a stop().

      • acceptGuarantees

        void acceptGuarantees(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,MonitorCheckpoint> guarantees)
        Receives information specifying what is guaranteed to be delivered to GSA. Every entry in passed in Map is a monitor name and MonitorCheckpoint. The monitor of that name can expect that all documents before and including document related with MonitorCheckpoint will be delivered to GSA. This information is for the convenience and efficiency of the Monitor so that it knows how many changes it has to resend. It's valid for a monitor to ignore these updates if it feels like it for some good reason. FileConnectorSystemMonitor instances use this information to trim their file system snapshots.

      • setTraversalSchedule

        void setTraversalSchedule(TraversalSchedule traversalSchedule)
        Receives TraversalSchedule from TraversalManager which is TraversalScheduleAware.
